subject: Re: problem with one time setup suite in a testcase conflict
msgSnippet: that worked. thanks. time to go and figure out how it actually works. ... do a ... say ... does ... TestCaseA ... the ... following?
messageBody:
that worked.
thanks.

time to go and figure out how it actually works.

--- In junit@y..., Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:
> korosh_afshar@y... wrote:
>
> > I have a TestCase in which I define a suite method so that I may
do a
> > one time setup for all the tests within that that TestCase. Lets
say
> > TestCaseA
> >
> > I have some other TestCases (none have a single setup like above)
> > defined as well. Lets call it TestCaseB, TestCaseC.
> >
> > I have an AllTest object to test alll of the above.
> >
> > It seems that as soon as I add the TestCase with the single setup
> > schecme (TestCaseA), to my AllTest, the TestCase.suite() which
does
> > the single time setup never gets called and subsequently my
TestCaseA
> > with the suite method fails.
> >
> > All the other TestCases (TestCaseB, TestCaseC) work alright with
the
> > AllTest.suite().
> >
>
> Are you defining the TestCaseA.suite() method similar to the
following?
>
> public static Test suite() {
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(TestCaseA.class);
>
> TestSetup oneTimer = new TestSetup(suite) {
> public void setUp() {
> oneTimeSetUp();
> }
> };
>
> return oneTimer;
> }
>
> And the AllTests.suite() method similar to the following?
>
> public static Test suite() {
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
>
> suite.addTest(TestCaseA.suite());
> suite.addTest(TestCaseB.suite());
> suite.addTest(TestCaseC.suite());
>
> return suite;
> }
>
> Mike
>
> --
> Mike Clark
> Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
> http://www.clarkware.com
